snippet: The moves by CBS and HBO signal a watershed moment for web-delivered television, where viewers have more options to pay only for the networks or programs they want to watch — and to decide how, when and where to watch them.
abstract: CBS announces its own subscription streaming service that lets people watch its live programming and thousands of current and past shows on demand; HBO is also starting an Internet-only offering; moves signal a watershed moment for web-delivered television, where viewers have more options to pay only for the networks or programs they want to watch and to decide how, when and where to watch them.
lead_paragraph: The moves by CBS and HBO signal a watershed moment for web-delivered television, where viewers have more options to pay only for the networks or programs they want to watch — and to decide how, when and where to watch them.

headline.main: Cord-Cutters Rejoice: CBS Joins Web Stream
headline.print_headline: Cord-Cutters Rejoice: CBS Joins Web Stream
